intro: Neuracanthus subuncinatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with dark green, narrow leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, appearing in clusters near the base of the plant. Neuracanthus subuncinatus is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a resilient species found in high-altitude habitats.
